platform","events":{"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._"},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"batchProcessActions(address[],uint8[],bytes32[],string[])":{"details":"Batch process multiple civic actions","params":{"actionHashes":"Array of action hashes","actionTypes":"Array of action types","metadataArray":"Array of metadata strings","users":"Array of user addresses"}},"getDistrictLeaderboard(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Get district leaderboard","params":{"districtHash":"Hash of the congressional district","limit":"Maximum number of entries to return"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of leaderboard entries"}},"getPlatformStats()":{"details":"Get platform statistics","returns":{"_0":"Platform statistics struct"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"pause()":{"details":"Emergency functions"},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"processCivicAction(address,uint8,bytes32,string)":{"details":"Process a civic action and reward user","params":{"actionHash":"Hash of the action details","actionType":"Type of civic action","metadata":"IPFS hash for additional data","user":"Address of the user who took action"}},"registerUser(address,bytes32,bytes)":{"details":"Register a new user in the system","params":{"districtHash":"Hash of the user's congressional district","user":"Address of the user"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setActionReward(uint8,uint256,bool)":{"details":"Set reward amount for action type","params":{"actionType":"Type of civic action","active":"Whether this action type is currently supported","reward":"Amount of CIVIC tokens to reward"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"updateActionInterval(uint256)":{"details":"Update minimum action interval","params":{"newInterval":"New minimum interval in seconds"}}},"title":"CommuniqueCore","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"notice":"Coordinates between VOTER registry and CIVIC token params.limit: Maximum number of entries to return

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

processCivicAction(address,uint8,bytes32.details: Process a civic action and reward user

params.user: Address of the user who took action

registerUser(address,bytes32,bytes).details: Register a new user in the system

params.districtHash: Hash of the user's congressional district

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setActionReward(uint8,uint256,bool).details: Set reward amount for action type

params.active: Whether this action type is currently supported
params.reward: Amount of CIVIC tokens to reward
